verses.verse: But it displeased <WH3415> Jonah <WH3124> exceedingly <WH1419>, and he was angry <WH2734>.

And he prayed <WH6419> unto Jehovah <WH3068>, and said <WH559>, I pray <WH577> thee <WH3068>, O Jehovah, was not this my saying <WH1697>, when I was yet in my country <WH127>? Therefore I hasted <WH1272> to <WH6923> flee unto Tarshish <WH8659>; for I knew <WH3045> that thou art a gracious <WH2587> God <WH410>, and merciful <WH7349>, slow <WH750> to anger <WH639>, and abundant <WH7227> in lovingkindness <WH2617>, and repentest <WH5162> thee of the evil <WH7451>.
Therefore now <WH3068>, O Jehovah, take <WH3947>, I beseech thee <WH5315>, my life from me <WH2896>; for it is better for me to die <WH4194> than to live <WH2416>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559>, Doest thou well <WH3190> to be angry <WH2734>?

Then Jonah <WH3124> went out <WH3318> of the city <WH5892>, and sat <WH3427> on the east side <WH6924> of the city <WH5892>, and there made <WH6213> him a booth <WH5521>, and sat <WH3427> under it in the shade <WH6738>, till he might see <WH7200> what would become of the city <WH5892>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a gourd <WH7021>, and made it to come up <WH5927> over Jonah <WH3124>, that it might be a shade <WH6738> over his head <WH7218>, to deliver <WH5337> him from his evil <WH7451> case <WH3124>. So Jonah was exceeding <WH1419> glad <WH8055> because of the gourd <WH7021>.
But God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a worm <WH8438> when the morning <WH7837> rose <WH5927> the next day <WH4283>, and it smote <WH5221> the gourd <WH7021>, that it withered <WH3001>.

And it came to pass <WH8121>, when the sun arose <WH2224>, that God <WH430> prepared <WH4487> a sultry <WH2759> east <WH6921> wind <WH7307>; and the sun <WH8121> beat <WH5221> upon the head <WH7218> of Jonah <WH3124>, that he fainted <WH5968>, and requested <WH7592> for himself <WH5315> that he might die <WH4191>, and said <WH559>, It is better <WH2896> for me to die <WH4194> than to live <WH2416>.

And God <WH430> said <WH559> to Jonah <WH3124>, Doest thou well <WH3190> to be angry <WH2734> for the gourd <WH7021>? And he said <WH559>, I do well <WH3190> to be angry <WH2734>, even unto death <WH4194>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559>, Thou hast had regard <WH2347> for the gourd <WH7021>, for which thou hast not labored <WH5998>, neither madest it grow <WH1431>; which came up in a night <WH1121>, and perished <WH6> in a night <WH1121>:

and should not I have regard <WH2347> for Nineveh <WH5210>, that great <WH1419> city <WH5892>, wherein are <WH3426> more <WH7235> than sixscore <WH8147> thousand <WH7239> persons <WH120> that cannot discern <WH3045> between their right hand <WH3225> and their left hand <WH8040>; and also much <WH7227> cattle <WH929>?
